Subject: Urgent Repair of Damaged Bridge Over the Canal
Dear [Chairman's Name],
I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. I am writing to you on behalf of the residents of [Your Village Name] regarding the urgent need for repairing the bridge over the canal that runs alongside our village.
As you are well aware, the bridge connecting our village to the neighboring areas has been in a state of disrepair for quite some time now. This bridge serves as a vital link for the people of our village, allowing daily commuters, school children, farmers, and emergency service providers to traverse the canal safely.
However, due to its deteriorating condition, crossing the bridge has become increasingly perilous. The safety of the individuals who rely on this bridge is at stake, and we cannot afford to ignore the potential risks any longer. Moreover, the damaged bridge is causing significant inconvenience and delays for the residents, hindering access to essential services and impeding economic activities in our village.
Therefore, we urge the Union Parishad to take immediate action to repair the bridge over the canal. We understand the constraints and challenges involved in such infrastructure projects, but the safety and well-being of our community members must be our top priority.
We are willing to cooperate fully and provide any necessary assistance to expedite the repair process. We sincerely hope that you will give this matter the utmost attention it deserves and take prompt measures to address the pressing issue at hand.
Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Sincerely,

questions.uddipok: Write a short composition on " Impact of Climate Change in Bangladesh ".

sub_questions.explanation:
Impact of Climate Change in Bangladesh
Long-term variation in temperatures and weather patterns is known as climate change. The frequent
shift of climate in Bangladesh has been showing a number of devastating effects, such as, rising sea level, floods and intensifying cyclones, Firstly, Rising sea level is a growing threat to people all around Bangladesh. To illustrate, Two-thirds of the land of this country is less than fifteen feet above sea level. So, the increase of sea level might cause extinction of huge low land area, Respondingly, The dwellers of the area may have to migrate from their own land. Secondly, Climate change is making rainfall more erratic and often far more intense. In terms of Bangladesh, this reality has recently become quite evident, Because of irregular rain and melting the Himalayan glaciers, Bangladesh is now far more vulnerable to devastating floods, Lastly and more importantly, The Bay of Bangal narrows towards its northern shore where it meets the south of coast Bangladesh. This narrowing can both direct cyclones towards Bangladesh's coast and make them more intense. To conclude, to minimize climate change, some immediate steps could be taken such as planting more trees, reducing the use of CFC gases, using electric vehicles, recycling plastic materials, In a word, People should practice eco-friendly behaviors to protect the nature as well as themselves.
